Roles Modifiers Amount Chance
First Death Shield Cleric Barrier Medic Shield Warden Fort First Death Shield Doused Hacked Flash Hypnosis Infection Scatter
Altruist Revive Dead Crewmates Revive dead crewmates in groups
The Altruist is a Crewmate Protective role can revive dead players in groups. However, their location and the revived players' locations will be revealed to all Impostors. Revive Reviving Revive a group of dead bodies near you. You will be frozen during the revival, and you will be unable to move until the revival is complete. Impostors will also have an arrow pointing towards you during the revival, so be cautious.
Revive Duration Revive Range Revive Uses Hide Bodies at Beginning Of Revive
Aurial Sense Disturbances In Your Aura. Any player abilities used within your aura you will sense
The Aurial is a Crewmate Investigative role that will be alerted whenever a player near them uses one of their abilities.
Radiate Colour Range Radiate Max Range Sense Duration
Cleric Save The Crewmates Barrier and Cleanse crewmates
The Cleric is a Crewmate Protective that can protect crewmates by negating their negative effects, as well as placing barriers on them to prevent interactions. Barrier Prevent a Crewmate from being interacted with. The shield will last for %BarrierCooldown% seconds. Cleanse Remove all negative effects on a player. (Douse, Hack, Infect, Blackmail, Blind, Flash, and Hypnosis)
Cleric Feedback: Cleansed effects on %player%: No negative effects were found on %player%.
Revive Duration Revive Range Revive Uses Hide Bodies at Beginning Of Revive
Deputy Camp Crewmates To Catch Their Killer Camp crewmates, then shoot their killer in the meeting! The Deputy is a Crewmate Killing role that can camp other players. Once a camped player dies, the Deputy is alerted to their death. The following meeting, the Deputy may then attempt to shoot the killer of the camped player. If successful the killer dies and if not nothing happens. Camp Camp a player to be alerted once they die. After their death, you may attempt to shoot the killer. If your shot is successful, the killer dies, if not, nothing will happen.
You missed your shot! They are either not the killer or are invincible.
Detective Inspect Crime Scenes To Catch The Killer Inspect crime scenes, then examine players to see if they were at the scene. The Deputy can inspect a crime scene and examine players to see if they were at the crime scene, flashing red if they were there. Inspect Crime scenes will spawn with all dead bodies. Inspect the crime scene and then examine players to discover clues. During the next meeting, you will recieve a report revealing the killer's role. Examine Examine players after inspecting a crime scene. You will be told if the player was at the crime scene.
Examine Cooldown Show Detective Reports Time Where Detective Will Have Role Time Where Detective Will Have Faction
%player% was at the scene of %deadPlayer%'s death!%nl%They might be the killer or a witness. %player% was not at the scene of the crime.
Engineer Maintain Important Systems On The Ship Vent around and fix sabotages remotely The Engineer is a Crewmate Support role that can vent and fix sabotages remotely. Fix It doesn't matter where you are on the map, you can use your fix button to instantly fix the active sabotage. You can do this %engiMaxFixes% times per game.
Vent Uses Per Game Vent Cooldown Vent Duration Fix Uses Per Game FIx Delay
Haunter
Complete all your tasks without getting caught to reveal impostors! The Haunter is a Crewmate Ghost who can do tasks. They will appear as a transparent player. If they finish all their tasks, all alive players will see who the Impostors are. However, if an Impostor clicks them first, they will become a normal ghost. Impostors get a warning shortly before and when the Haunter finishes their tasks.
TasksLeftBeforeClickable TasksLeftBeforeAlerted RevealNeutralRoles CanBeClickedBy
You have alerted the Killers! A Haunter is loose, catch them before they reveal you!
Hunter Stalk The %coloredImpostor% Stalk player interactions and kill impostors, but not Crewmates Stalking: Caught Players: The Hunter is a Crewmate Killing role that can stalk players during the round. If a stalked player uses an ability, they can be killed by the Hunter at any point in the game, even Crew. Stalk Choose a target to stalk. You can stalk %hunterMaxStalkUsages% players. If they use any ability while stalked, they're added to your hitlist and can be killed.
Hunter Kill Cooldown Hunter Stalk Cooldown Hunter Stalk Duration Max Stalk Uses Get More Uses From Completing Tasks Hunter Kills Last Voter If Voted Out Hunter Can Report Who They've Killed
Imitator Use Dead Roles To Benefit The Crew Use the true-hearted dead to benefit the crew once more The Imitator is a Crewmate Support role that can select a dead crewmate to imitate their role. They will become their role and abilities until they change targets. Certain roles are innacessible if there are multiple living imitators. Crewmate Imitation All crewmate roles are available besides Imitator, and Crewmate. Politician, Mayor, Prosecutor and Jailor are limited, as they can only be selected if no other Imitators exist. Jailor and Prosecutor cannot use their meeting abilities, and Vigi does not get safe shots. Neutral Counterparts Amnesiac ⇨ Medic | Doom ⇨ Vigi | Exe ⇨ Snitch%nl%Glitch ⇨ Sheriff | GA ⇨ Cleric | Inquis ⇨ Oracle%nl%Jester ⇨ Plumber | Merc ⇨ Warden%nl%Pb/Pest ⇨ Aurial | SC ⇨ Medium | WW ⇨ Hunter Impostor Counterparts Bomber ⇨ Trapper | Hypnotist ⇨ Lookout | Janitor ⇨ Detective%nl%Miner ⇨ Engineer | Scavenger ⇨ Tracker%nl%Undertaker ⇨ Altruist | Warlock ⇨ Veteran
Imitate Specific Neutrals As Similar Crew Roles Imitate Specific Impostors As Similar Crew Roles
Investigator Find All Impostors By Examining Footprints. You can see everyone's footprints. The Investigator is a Crewmate Investigative role can see player's footprints throughout the game. Swooped players' footprints will not be visible to the Investigator.
Footprint Size Footprint Interval Footprint Duration Anonymous Footprint Footprint Vent Visible
Jailor Jail And Execute The %coloredImpostorText% Execute evildoers in meetings but avoid crewmates The Jailor is a Crewmate Power role that can jail other players. During a meeting, the Jailor can choose to execute their jailed player. (Unless the Jailor is an Imitator) Jail Jail a player. During the meeting everyone will see who is jailed. You can privately talk with your detained player using the instructions that are in the private chatbox Execute (Meeting) Execute the detained player. If the player is a crewmate the Jailor will lose the ability to Jail.
Jail Cooldown Max Number Of Executes Jail Same Person Twice In A Row Jailee Can Use Public Chat
Communicate with your jailee in the %bold%RED%unbold% private chatbox next to the %bold%REGULAR%unbold% chatbox. %jailee% cannot be executed! They must be Invulnerable! %jailee% was a crewmate! You can no longer jail anyone! %jailee% was successfully executed!
Lookout Keep Your Eyes Wide Open Watch other crewmates to see what roles interact with them The Lookout is a Crewmate Investigative role that can watch other players during rounds. During meetings they will see all roles who interact with each watched player. Watch Watch a player or multiple, the next meeting you will know which players interacted with the watched ones.
Watch Cooldown Max Players That Can be Watched Lookout Watches Reset After Each Round
Mayor Reveal Yourself To Save The Crew Lead the crew to victory! The Mayor is a Crewmate Power role that gains three votes and is revealed to all players, also changing their look in meetings.
Medic Create A Shield To Protect A Crewmate Protect a crewmate with a shield The Medic is a Crewmate Protective role that can give a Shield to a player. Shield Give a Shield to a player, protecting them from being killed by others
Show Shielded Player Who Gets Murder Attempt Indicator Can Give Shield Away Next Round Max Amount of Shield Uses Shield Breaks On Murder Attempt Show Reports in Chat Time Where Medic Will Have Name Time Where Medic Will Have Color Type
Medium Watch The Spooky Ghosts Follow ghosts to get clues from them The Medium is a Crewmate Support role who can Mediate to see one ghost per use. Both the Medium and Ghost then have an arrow showing them where each other are at all times. Mediate Communicate with the dead, which may lead you to the killers.
Mediate Cooldown Reveal Appearence of Mediate Target Arrow Visibility Who is Revealed
Mirrorcaster Reflect Attacks Onto Others Protect a player with a Magic Mirror.%nl%f they are directly attacked, then%nl%unleash the attack onto another player! The Mirrorcaster is a Crewmate Protective role that can cast a Magic Mirror on a player to protect them. If attacked directly, the Mirrorcaster can then unleash onto another player. Magic Mirror Place a Mirror on a player. If the player is attacked directly, then you will be notified and you will be able to unleash onto another player. Roles that ignore the Magic Mirror are Arsonist, Veteran, Pestilence, Bomber (if the player is bombed), and a few others. Unleash Once the Magic Mirror shatters, utilize its power to unleash the attack onto another player!
Who Gets Murder Attempt Indicator Magic Mirror Cooldown Magic Mirror Duration Unleash Cooldown Mirrorcaster Knows The Absorbed Type Of Attack Accumulate Multiple Unleashes Max Number Of Magic Mirrors
%protectedPlayer% was attacked by the %attackerRoleNiceName%! You can now unleash the attack onto another player! %protectedPlayer% was attacked! You can now unleash the attack onto another player!
Mystic Know When and Where Kills Happen Understand when and where kills happen The Mystic is a Crewmate Investigative role that gets an alert when someone dies.
Dead Body Arrow Duration
Oracle Get Other Player's To Confess Their Sins Get another player to confess on your passing The Oracle is a Crewmate Protective role that can get another player to confess (revealing their faction with %revealAccuracy%% accuracy if the Oracle dies) or can protect a player from meeting abilities. Bless Blessing a player prevents any harm from being done to them in the meeting. Confess Make a player confess in a meeting, giving a vision of 3 possible evils (including the confessor), and also reveal their faction to everyone with %revealAccuracy%% accuracy when the Oracle dies.
Confess Cooldown Bless Cooldown Reveal Accuracy Neutral Benign Show Up As Evil Neutral Evil Show Up As Evil Neutral Killing Show Up As Evil
Your confessor failed to survive so you received no confession Too few people alive to receive a confessional %confessor% confesses to knowing that there are no more evil players! %firstPlayer% confesses to knowing that they, %secondPlayer% and/or %thirdPlayer% is evil! Your blessing has saved %blessedUser% from getting guessed! %blessedUser% survived due to being blessed by an %coloredOracleText%!
Plumber Get The Rats Out Of The Sewers Flush the vent system to kick venters out, and\nbarricade vents to block them the next round The Plumber is a Crewmate Support role that can place Barricades on vents and Flush anyone out of vents. Flush Flushing the vents makes every vent open and close, kicking out anyone who is actively in a vent. The Plumber also gets an arrow pointing to every flushed player for one second. Barricade Barricading a vent places a barricade on the vent selected for the next round, preventing players from using it.
Flush Cooldown Block Cooldown Max Number Of Barricades Amount Of Rounds Barricades Last Get More Barricades From Completing Tasks
Politician Campaign To Become The Mayor! Spread your campaign to become the Mayor! The Politician is a Crewmate Power role that can reveal themselves to the crew as the Mayor, given that they have campaigned at least half of the crewmates. Campaign Give a player a ballot, which will only be useful to you if they are a Crewmate. Reveal (Meeting) If you reveal, and you have more than half of the crewmates campaigned (or no other crewmates remain), you will become the Mayor! Otherwise, your ability will fail and you %canOrCant% campaign the following round.
Campaign Cooldown Prevent Campaigning on Failed Reveal
You need to campaign more Crewmates! You may not reveal again in this meeting. You need to campaign more Crewmates! However, you may not campaign next round. %mayorColor%Politician Feedback
Prosecutor Exile Players Of Your Choosing Choose to exile anyone you want The Prosecutor is a Crewmate Power role that can Exile a player, applying 5 votes to a player of their choosing. They can also see who voted for who, even if they're anonymous. Prosecute (Meeting) Exile any player of your choosing, throwing 5 votes on them and ignoring all other votes.
Prosecutor Dies When They Exile A Crewmate Max Prosecutions
Seer Reveal The Alliance Of Other Players Reveal alliances of other players to find the Impostors The Seer is a Crewmate Investigative role that can reveal the alliance of other players. Reveal Reveal the faction of a player
Seer Cooldown Crewmate Killing Roles Are Red Neutral Benign Roles Are Red Neutral Evil Roles Are Red Neutral Killing Roles Are Red Traitor Swaps Colors
Sheriff Shoot The %coloredImpostorText% Kill off the impostors but don't kill crewmates The Sheriff is a Crewmate Killing that can shoot a player to attempt to kill them. If Sheriff doesn't die to misfire, they will lose the ability to shoot. Shoot Shoot a player to kill them, misfiring if they aren't a Impostor or one of the other selected shootable factions
Kill Cooldown Can Self Report Allow Shooting in First Round Can Shoot Neutral Evil Roles Can Shoot Neutral Killing Roles Misfire Kills
Snitch Find the %coloredImpostorText%! Complete all your tasks to discover the Impostors. Help the Impostors! The Snitch is a Crewmate Investigative role that can reveal the Impostors to themselves by finishing all their tasks. Upon completing all tasks, the Impostors will be revealed to the Snitch with an arrow and their red name.
Snitch Reveals Neutral Killers Snitch Sees Traitor Snitch Sees Impostors In Meetings Tasks Remaining When Revealed
Spy Snoop Around And Find Stuff Out Gain extra information on the Admin Table The Spy is a Crewmate Investigative role that gains extra information on the admin table. They not only see how many people are in a room, but will also see who is in every room.
Who Sees Dead Bodies On Admin Allow Portable Admin Table For Move While Using Portable Admin Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Portable Admin Display Cooldown Portable Admin Display Duration
Swapper Swap Votes To Save The Crew! Swap votes from one player to another during a meeting The Swapper is a Crewmate Power that can swap the votes of two players in a meeting. Their meeting vote areas will be swapped visually, and the votes will be swapped. If player 1 recieved the most votes, and you swap them with player 2, player 2 will now be ejected instead. Swap (Meeting) Select two players to swap votes for, and at the end of the meeting, they will swap spots!
Can Call Button
Tracker Track Everyone's Movement Track suspicious players to see where they go The Tracker is a Crewmate Investigative role that can track other players to see their general position across the map, getting colored arrows towards all tracked players. Track Track a player to see where they go. You will have an arrow pointing to their location that will update periodically. It will disappear if they die, or depending on settings, the trackers will be reset after a meeting.
Track Cooldown Max Number Of Tracks Arrow Update Interval Tracker Arrows Make Sound On Death Tracker Arrows Reset After Each Round
Transporter Choose Two Players To Swap Locations Choose two players to swap locations with one another The Transporter is a Crewmate Support role that can transport two players, dead or alive, to swap their locations. Transport Switch the positions of two players. Players can be transported out of vents. A red flash means one of the players became an invalid target, such as going on a ladder or zipline
Transport Cooldown Max Uses Move While Using Transport Menu (KB ONLY) Can Use Vitals Get More Uses From Completing Tasks
%transporterColor%You were transported!
Trapper Catch Killers In The Act Place traps around the map, revealing roles within them The Trapper is a Crewmate Investigative role that can place traps around the map. If someone stays in it for enough time and enough players go through, they will get a list of their roles in the next meeting in random order. Trap Places a trap. Depending on settings they may stay the entire game or reset after meetings.
Trap Cooldown Min Amount Of Time In Trap To Register Max Number Of Traps Trap Size Traps Removed After Each Round Minimum Number Of Roles Required To Trigger Trap
No players entered any of your traps Not enough players triggered your traps Roles caught in your trap:%nl%
Veteran Alert To Kill Anyone Who Interacts With You Alert to kill whoever who interacts with you. The Veteran is a Crewmate Killing role that can go on alert and kill anyone who interacts with them. Alert When the Veteran is on alert, any player who interacts with them will be instantly killed, with the exception of Pestilence and shielded players, who will ignore the attack.
Alert Cooldown Alert Duration Max Number of Alerts Can Be Killed On Alert Get More Uses From Completing Tasksor G
Vigilante Kill Impostors If You Can Guess Their Roles Guess the roles of impostors mid-meeting to kill them! The Vigilante is a Crewmate Killing role that can guess players roles in meetings. If they guess correctly, the other player will die. If not, they will die.
Number Of Guesses Can Guess More Than Once Per Meeting Can Guess Neutral Benign Roles Can Guess Neutral Evil Roles Can Guess Neutral Killing Roles Can Guess Killer Modifiers Can Guess Alliances Safe Shots Available
Warden Fortify Crewmates Fortify crewmates to prevent interactions with them The Warden is a Crewmate Protective role that can fortify players to prevent them from being interacted with. Fortify Fortify a player to prevent them from being interacted with. If anyone tries to interact with a fortified player, the ability will not work and both the Warden and fortified player will be alerted with a purple flash.
Show Fortify Player
Ambassador Ambusher Blackmailer Bomber Eclipsal Escapist Grenadier Herbalist Hypnotist Infestor Janitor Miner Morphling Scavenger Swooper Traitor Undertaker Venerer Warlock
Amnesiac Remember A Role Of A Deceased Player Find a dead body to remember and become their role. The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that gains access to a new role from remembering a dead body’s role. Use the role you remember to win the game. Remember Remember the role of a dead body. If the dead body's role is a unique role, you will remember the base faction's role instead.
Show Arrows Pointing To Dead Bodies Time After Death Arrow Appears
Arsonist Douse Players And Ignite The Light Douse players and ignite to kill all nearby doused targets. Douse players and ignite the closest one to kill all doused targets. The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can douse players and ignite them when close. They can douse players and ignite one of them to ignite all doused players on the map.
Douse Douse a player in gasoline. Ignite Kill multiple doused players around you, given that they are within your radius. Kill every doused player on the map as long as you ignite one player close by.
Douse Cooldown Douse From Interactions Legacy Mode (No Radius) Arsonist Can Vent
Doomsayer Guess People's Roles To Win! Win by guessing the roles of %doomsayerNeededGuessCount% players. The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by guessing %doomsayerNeededGuessCount% players' roles. They may observe players to get a hint of what their roles are the following meeting.
Observe Observe a player, gaining a hint in the next meeting what their role could be.
Observe Cooldown Number Of Guesses Needed To Win Doomsayer Can Guess Crew Investigative Roles Doomsayer Guesses All Roles At Once Doomsayer Can't Observe Doomsayer Win
Executioner Get %target% voted out to win. Get %target% voted out to win. your target The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by getting their target (signified by %symbol%) ejected in a meeting.
On Target Death, Executioner Becomes Executioner Can Button Executioner Win
Glitch Murder, Mimic, Hack... Data Lost Murder everyone to win with your abilities! The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can Mimic into another player, or they can hack a player.
Mimic Mimic the appearance of another player, taking on their whole look. Hack Disable a player's abilities.
Kill Cooldown Mimic Cooldown Mimic Duration Move While Using Mimic Menu (KB ONLY) Hack Cooldown Hack Duration Glitch Can Vent
Guardian Angel Protect %target% With Your Life! Protect %target% With Your Life! Protect Your Target With Your Life! The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign that needs to protect their target (signified by %symbol%) from getting killed/ejected.
Protect Protect your target from getting killed.
Protect Cooldown Protect Duration Max Number Of Protects Show Protected Player On Target Death, GA Becomes Target Knows GA Exists GA Knows Targets Role Odds Of Target Being Evil
Inquisitor Vanquish The Heretics! Vanquish your Heretics or get them killed.%nl%You will win after every heretic dies.%nlIf they're all dead after a meeting ends,%nlyou'll leave %and% announce your victory The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins if their targets (Heretics) die. The only information provided is their roles, and it's up to the Inquisitor to identify those players (marked with %symbol% to the dead) and get them killed by any means necessary.
Inquire Inquire a player, which will tell you if they are one of your targets within the meeting. Vanquish Vanquish a player to kill them. If they are a heretic, you will be told, and you can continue vanquishing. However, if the victim isn't a heretic, you will lose the ability to vanquish for the rest of the game.
Vanquish Cooldown Inquisitor Continues Game In Final 3 Inquisitor Can't Inquire Inquire Cooldown Max Number Of Inquiries Amount Of Heretics Needed
Jester Get voted out! Be as suspicious as possible, and get voted out! The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by getting themselves ejected.
Can Use Button Can Hide In Vents Has Impostor Vision Scatter Mechanic Enabled Scatter Timer After Win Type
Juggernaut Your Power Grows With Every Kill With each kill your kill cooldown decreases. The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. For each kill they get, their kill cooldown gets reduced.
Initial Kill Cooldown Kill Cooldown Reduction Juggernaut Can Vent
Mercenary Bribe The Crewmates Guard crewmates, and then bribe the winners! The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that can only win by bribing players, allowing them to gain multiple win conditions.
Guard Guarding a player allows the Mercenary to absorb an ability used on the target. This will grant them gold, for Bribing. If any bribed targets win, the Mercenary will win with them. Bribe Bribing a player allows the Mercenary to gain their win condition, given that they have gold to spare.
Bribe Cooldown Max Number Of Guards Bribe Cost
Pestilence Horseman Of The Apocalypse! Kill everyone in your path that interacts with you! You Are The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that can kill and is invincible to everything but being exiled or guessing incorrectly. They win by being the last killer alive.
Phantom
Complete all your tasks without being caught! The %roleName% is a Neutral Ghost role that wins the game by finishing their tasks before a alive player has clicked on them.
Tasks Left Before Clickable Phantom Win
Plaguebearer Infect Everyone To Become %pestilenceName% Infect everyone to become %pestilenceName% The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that needs to infect all other players to turn into the Pestilence.
Infect Infect a player, causing them to be infected. When an infected player or dead body interacts or gets interacted with, the infection will spread to the interacted/interacting player.
Instant Pestilence Chance Infect Cooldown Announce Pestilence Transformation Pestilence Kill Cooldown Pestilence Can Vent
Soul Collector Reap The Souls From Your Crewmates Reap the souls of others, leaving behind a lasting image The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that takes the soul of players. Instead of leaving a body behind, they leave behind a soul-less decoy that looks identical to the reaped player, standing still.
Reap Reaping acts like a kill button, but instead of making a dead body, makes a fake player in its place, appearing alive.
Reap Cooldown Soul Collector Can Vent
Survivor Do Whatever It Takes To Live Stay alive to win with any faction remaining The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that just needs to survive until the end of the game.
Vest Put on a Vest protecting you from attacks.
Vest Cooldown Vest Duration Max Number Of Vests Survivor Scatter Mechanic Enabled Survivor Scatter Timer
Vampire Convert Crewmates And Kill The Rest Bite all other players The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer(s) alive. They can bite, changing others into Vampires, or kill players.
Bite Bite a player. If the bitten player is a Crewmate and you have not exceeded the maximum amount of vampires in a game yet. You convert them into a vampire. Otherwise, they just get killed.
Bite Cooldown Max Number Of Vampires Per Game Vampires Have Impostor Vision New Vampires Can Assassinate Valid Conversions New Vampires Can Convert Vampires Can Vent
Werewolf Rampage To Kill Everyone Rampage to kill everyone in your path The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can go on a rampage to gain the ability to kill.
Rampage Go on a Rampage, gaining the ability to kill and gain Impostor vision. During the Rampage your kill cooldown is significantly lower.
Rampage Cooldown Rampage Duration Rampage Kill Cooldown Werewolf Can Vent When Rampaged
Egotist Your Ego is Thriving... Defy the crew, win with killers. The Egotist is a Crewmate Alliance modifier (signified by %symbol%). As the Egotist, you can only win if Crewmates lose, even when dead. If no crewmates remain after a meeting ends, you will leave in victory, but the game will continue.
Lover You are in love with %lover%. You are in love with %lover%. As a %lowerName%, you can chat with your other %lowerName% (signified with %symbol%) during the round, and you can win with your %lowerName% if you are both a part of the final 3 players.
Both Lovers Die And Revive Together Loving Another Killer Probability Neutral Roles Can Be Lovers Lover Can Kill Faction Teammates Lovers Can Kill One Another
Lovers
Button Barry You can call a meeting%nl% from anywhere on the map. You can button from anywhere on the map. Button You can trigger an emergency meeting from across the map, %barryUsages% time(s) per game.
Button Cooldown Max Uses Ignore Sabotages Allow Usage in First Round
Flash You move %flashSpeed%x faster. You move %flashSpeed% x faster than regular players.
Flash Speed
Giant You are bigger than the average player, moving %giantSpeed%x slower You are bigger than regular players, and you also move %giantSpeed%x slower than regular players.
Giant Speed
Immovable You cannot be teleported to the meeting area, and you cannot get dispersed or teleported. You are unable to be moved via abilities and meetings.
Mini You are smaller than regular players, and you also move %miniSpeed%x faster than regular players. You are smaller than the average player, moving %miniSpeed%x faster.
Mini Speed
Radar Get an arrow to the closest player. You have an arrow pointing%nl% to the closest player.
Satellite You can broadcast a signal to know where dead bodies are. You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do %broadcastMaxUsages% time(s) per game. Broadcast You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do %maxUsages% time(s) per game.
Button Cooldown Max Uses One Usage Per Round Allow Usage in First Round
Shy You become transparent when %nl%standing still for a short duration. You blend in with the environment, becoming transparent when staying still.
Transparency Delay Turn Transparent Duration Final Opacity
Sixth Sense Know when someone interacts with you. You will know when someone uses their ability on you.
Sleuth Know the roles of bodies you report. You will see the roles of bodies you report.
Tiebreaker Your vote breaks ties. Your vote allows you to break ties.
Disperser You can also disperse players to vents around the map. Separate the Crew. Disperse everyone on the map to a random vent, given that they are not Immovable. You cannot have any other button modifiers with %modifierName%. Disperse You can disperse players on the map to random vents, which you can do once per game.
Saboteur You also have reduced sabotage cooldowns. You have reduced sabotage cooldowns. You have a reduced cooldown when sabotaging.
Telepath You also know information about teammates' kills%ifDeaths%. and deaths %advancedDescription% Know when%ifKill% your teammate kills %and% where , know when%ifLoc% they die. %and% where
Know Where Teammate Kills Know When Teammate Dies Know Where Teammate Dies Dead Body Arrow Duration Know When Teammate Guesses Successfully Know When Teammate Fails To Guess
Underdog Your kill cooldown is also faster when you're on your own. When you're alone your kill cooldown is shortened. Your kill cooldown is lower if you're solo or your teammate is dead.
Kill Cooldown Bonus Increased Kill Cooldown When 2+ Imps
Assassin
Double Shot You also get a second chance when guessing. You get a second chance when you fail to guess a player in a meeting. You have an extra chance when assassinating.
Aftermath You will also trigger your killer's abilities upon death. Your killer will be forced to use their abilities! After you die, your killer will be forced to use their abilities, targetting your body or targetting themselves.
Bait You will also force your killer to report your body. Force your killer to self-report. After you die, your killer will self-report, reporting your body.
Min Bait Report Delay Max Bait Report Delay
Celebrity You will also reveal info about your death in the meeting. Announce how you died on your passing. After you die, details about your death will be revealed such as where you were killed and which role killed you during the meeting.
Diseased You will also extend your killer's cooldown upon death. Increase your killer's kill cooldown. After you die, your killer's kill cooldown is multiplied by a factor of %diseasedMultiplier%x.
Diseased Kill Modifier
Frosty You will also slow down your killer upon death. Slow your killer for a short duration. After you die, your killer will be slowed down!
Chill Duration Chill Start Speed
Multitasker You can also see through tasks. Your tasks are transparent. All your menus are seethrough, allowing you to look behind menus!
Noisemaker You will also alert all players to your body upon death. When you die, you will send an alert to all players on the map for %noisemakerTime% second(s). After your death, you will show a red body indicator to everyone on the map.
Impostors Get Alert Neutrals Get Alert Comms Sabotage Prevents Alert Only Triggers If a Body Exists Alert Duration
Operative You can also use security systems on-the-go. Utilize the Cameras from anywhere. Use cameras at anytime with a limited battery charge.
Move While Using Mira Doorlog Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Security Display Cooldown Max Security Display Duration
Rotting Your body will also rot away upon death. Your body will rot away after %rottingDelay% second(s). After %rottingDelay% second(s), your body will rot away, preventing you from being reported
Time Before Body Rots Away
Scientist You can also use vitals on-the-go. Access vitals anytime, anywhere, as long as you have charge. Access Vitals at anytime with a limited battery charge.
Move While Using Vitals Starting Charge Battery Charged Each Round Battery Charged Per Task Vitals Display Cooldown Max Vitals Display Duration
Scout You can also see farther in light but very low in dark. Your vision is higher when lights are on, but very low when lights are off. While you can see twice as far as a regular crewmate, your vision falters when lights are off.
Taskmaster You also finish random tasks each round. A random task is auto completed for you after each meeting. Every time a round starts, you will automatically finish a task.
Torch You can also see without lights on. Your vision won't get reduced%nl%when the lights are sabotaged. The lights being off do not affect your vision.
